channel.title: Posts on Martin's #rstats blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Martin's #rstats blog

item.title: Exploring WW2 figher pilots
item.description: The WW2 fighter pilot data These data come from the Wikipedia page here, and I went over downloading these data in my previous post. In this post, I am going to be covering some ggplot2 graphs and theme customization examples. I will also be using the skimr and janitor packages. Load the packages library(tidyverse) library(magrittr) library(skimr) library(styler) Download data The data from the previous post have been stored in a Github repo here.

item.title: WW2 fighter pilots - scraping html tables
item.description: This post covers how to scrape a wikipedia table and store it in an R data frame. Below is an example setup code chunk. library(knitr) if (!("devtools" %in% installed.packages())) { install.packages("devtools") } # images folder if (!file.exists("images")) { dir.create("images") } # data folder if (!file.exists("data")) { dir.create("data") } opts_chunk$set( echo = FALSE, tidy = FALSE, size = "small", fig.path = "images" ) options(tibble.width = 78) The data I want to download a table of World War II flying aces from Wikipedia.
